verses.roman:
padbhyāṁ tāla-pramāṇābhyāṁ
kampayann avanī-talam
so 'bhyadhāvad vṛto bhūtair
dvārakāṁ pradahan diśaḥ

synonyms: padbhyām—with his legs; tāla—of palm trees; pramāṇābhyām—whose measure; kampayan—shaking; avanī—of the earth; talam—the surface; saḥ—he; abhyadhāvat—ran; vṛtaḥ—accompanied; bhūtaiḥ—by ghostly spirits; dvārakām—toward Dvārakā; pradahan—burning up; diśaḥ—the directions.
translation: On legs as tall as palm trees, the monster raced toward Dvārakā in the company of ghostly spirits, shaking the ground and burning the world in all directions.
